net.sourceforge.aglets.util.gui
Class JComponentBuilder

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.aglets.util.gui.JComponentBuilder

public class JComponentBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents an utility class which aim is to build a standardized JCOmponent, like a JLabel or a JButton to use in the GUI of the platform (i.e., the Tahiti server) or in a swing application/agent. The idea of this class is that for each main JComponent you want to create, you can get one localized thru a resource bundle or a property file. By default this class works with the Tahiti property file (lib/tahiti.properties) for the localization. You should use this class thru a set of keys, that are strings that represents a component of your dialog window, thus the system can automatically bind the icon for such key. For instance, for a JLabel in the status memoryBar com.ibm.aglets.tahiti.MainWindow object, you should use a key like com.ibm.aglets.tahiti.MainWindow.statusBarLabel (or something similar) and provide in the tahiti.properties file the translation and the icon as follows: com.ibm.aglets.tahiti.MainWindow.statusBarLabel = "Text for the status memoryBar" com.ibm.aglets.tahiti.MainWindow.statusBarLabel.icon = "/path/to/the/icon"

Author:
Luca Ferrari - cat4hire@users.sourceforge.net 06/set/07

Method Detail

getIcon

public static javax.swing.Icon getIcon(java.lang.String key)
Returns an incon for the specified key, appended with the ".icon" suffix. This means that if your icon key is something like com.ibm.aglets.tahiti.MainWindow.createButton, then the image file will be searched in the translator with the key com.ibm.aglets.tahiti.MainWindow.createButton.icon Please note that if the file does not exists, then the icon returned will be null.

Parameters:
key - the key that identifies the component to search the icon for, without the .icon suffix.
Returns:
the created icon

getTitle

public static java.lang.String getTitle(java.lang.String key)
Provides the title for a window, that is the translation for the .title key.

Parameters:
key - the key of the window
Returns:
the translated title or null

getMnemonic

public static char getMnemonic(java.lang.String key)
Provides the mnemonic shortcut for a menu entry.

Parameters:
key - the base key of the menu
Returns:
the char for the memo entry

getTooltipText

public static java.lang.String getTooltipText(java.lang.String key)
Provides the tooltip text of the specified key, already translated and localized thru the translator. The tooltip for a component must be specified thru the key of the component itself and the TOOLTIP_KEY_SUFFIX suffix. For instance, the tooltip for the component com.ibm.aglets.tahiti.mainWindow.OkButton is specfied thru com.ibm.aglets.tahiti.mainWindow.OkButton.

Parameters:
key - the key of the component
Returns:
the localized tooltip string (if any)

createJLabel

protected static final javax.swing.JLabel createJLabel(java.lang.String text,
                                                       javax.swing.Icon icon)
Creates a new JLabel with the specified text (not to be translated but already translated) and icon.

Parameters:
text - the text to display in the label
icon - the icon to show
Returns:
the JLabel created

createJLabel

public static final javax.swing.JLabel createJLabel(java.lang.String key)
Builds a JLabel for the specified key. You should specify the key the method should use to refers to your JLabel, and specify in the property file or ResourceBundle. The text to display will be took from the ResourceBundle/property file, the icon from the same file/bundle but with the ".icon" suffix appended.

Parameters:
key - the key to use for the lookup in the property file/resource bundle
Returns:
the created JLabel, with the specified icon and translated text.

createJButton

public static final javax.swing.JButton createJButton(java.lang.String key,
                                                      java.lang.String actionCommand,
                                                      java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
Creates a specific JButton with an associated icon and tooltip, specified from the key string. In other word the string key is used to lookup in the resource bundle for the resource specified, and the .icon and .tooltip keys are also looked up.

Parameters:
key - the key for this entry, you should also specify the key.icon and key.tooltip properties
actionCommand - the action command for this button, if not specified it will be set equal to the specified key
listener - the action listener associated to this button (if there's one)
Returns:
the created button

createJCheckBox

public static final javax.swing.JCheckBox createJCheckBox(java.lang.String key,
                                                          boolean selected,
                                                          java.awt.event.ItemListener listener)
Creates a checkbox with the specified label, tooltip, and so on.

Parameters:
key - the key for the lookup in the localized resources
selected - true if the checkbox must be selected by default
listener - the listener of this checkbox
Returns:
the checkbox

createJTextField

public static final javax.swing.JTextField createJTextField(int size,
                                                            java.lang.String initialText,
                                                            java.lang.String key)
Creates a JTextField with the specified size and the initial text.

Parameters:
size - the size of the textfield, must be greated than zero
initialText - the initial text to display (not mandatory)
key - the key for the tooltip or initial text or something else
Returns:
the created textfield or null if the size is less or equal zero

createJPasswordField

public static final javax.swing.JPasswordField createJPasswordField(int size)
Creates a password field with the specified size.

Parameters:
size - the size of the field
Returns:
the field or null

createOkCancelButtonPanel

public static final OkCancelButtonPanel createOkCancelButtonPanel(java.lang.String okKey,
                                                                  java.lang.String cancelKey,
                                                                  java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
Constructs a generic OK/Cancel two buttons panel with the button associated to the specified listener. Please note that the keys OK_BUTTON and CANCEL_BUTTON (and their derivates) must be present in the resource bundle.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to use with these buttons
okKey - the key used for the button ok, if null it will be used a default string
cancelKey - the key for the cancel, if null a default string will be used
Returns:
the panel with the two buttons

showErrorDialog

public static final void showErrorDialog(javax.swing.JFrame parentFrame,
                                         java.lang.String key)

createLogoPanel

public static ImagePanel createLogoPanel()
Creats a panel that contains the logo of the aglets project. In the case the logo cannot be found, then null is returned.

Returns:
the image panel or null

createSmallLogoPanel

public static ImagePanel createSmallLogoPanel()
Creates a small logo panel with the small logo image.

Returns:
the image panel or null

                                                    java.lang.String actionCommand,
                                                    java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
Creates a specific menu entry.

Parameters:

actionCommand - the action command to associate to the item
listener - the listener to add to the menu entry
Returns:
the menu entry

createJMenu

public static javax.swing.JMenu createJMenu(java.lang.String key)
Builds a JMenu with the translated text (if available).

Parameters:
key - the key for the lookup of the text
Returns:
the menu or null if it cannot be built.

getTranslator

public static final AgletsTranslator getTranslator()
Gets back the translator.

Returns:
the translator

createJTextArea

public static javax.swing.JTextArea createJTextArea(java.lang.String fileName)
Returns a text area.

Parameters:
fileName - if specified and not null, the file is read and each line is appended to the text area. If the file cannot be read, than the text area cotnent is set to empty.
Returns:
the text area (empty of with the file content).
